div.p:
Educating Murray since 1906,
WE ARE MURRAY!

a.span: Some MCSD students see digital home learning as pr

img.alt: Some MCSD students see digital home learning as pretty far out! #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

a.span: Parkside Special Education Teacher Lisa Pearson's

img.alt: Parkside Special Education Teacher Lisa Pearson's knows how to keep her digital home instruction day organized! Nice work! #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

a.span: We stay strong and we finish strong - thanks Hillc

img.alt: We stay strong and we finish strong - thanks Hillcrest Jr. High! #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

a.span: Horizon's Amara Spere has incorporated weekly yoga

img.alt: Horizon's Amara Spere has incorporated weekly yoga to help her students focus... #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

a.span: Important information for students and parents re:

img.alt: Important information for students and parents re: end of year plans, grades, returns, and much more: https://bit.ly/MCSDApr23

a.span: Watch your step... MCSD students are learning ever

img.alt: Watch your step... MCSD students are learning everywhere and might even be right under your feet. #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

a.span: Too soon to go to school, but not too early to see

img.alt: Too soon to go to school, but not too early to see big sister keeping up with her school work at home. #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

a.span: Horizon Elementary partnered with the Utah Food Ba

img.alt: Horizon Elementary partnered with the Utah Food Bank and IMC recently to pass out more than 70 food bags to families in need recently... schools are more than just buildings they represent kindness, generosity, and collaboration to name only a few attributes. #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

br.em: Please note these hours are adjusted per Salt Lake County’s Stay Home, Stay Safe order.

div.p: Murray City School District has made a change to our enrollment policy for nonresident students PS 443 “Non-Resident Students Enrollment & Graduation.” The changes are specific to the process and criteria for determining the eligibility of non-resident students with disabilities. The district invites qualified students with disabilities to apply for attendance in any of our schools. The entire explanation may be found online under Board Policy PS 443.
If you have alumni information to share, check out our Alumni News page on this website.

Results of school asbestos inspections by accredited inspectors are available for public viewing in each Murray school or at the Murray City School District Maintenance Department, 5601 South 320 West Commerce Drive; phone 801-264-7410. Asbestos re-inspections are done, as required by law every three years, with surveillance at six-month intervals.
